review_title: An excellent place for Christian educators to work!
job_title: Associate Professor in Point Lookout, MO
pros: Students, faculty and staff are a joy to work with.
cons: It's challenging to keep the hours worked to a reasonable and healthy level.

review_title: Good work environment but a little boring
job_title: Public Safety Student Officer in Point Lookout, MO
pros: Easy job and plenty of time for homework
cons: Gets really repetitive driving in circles around campus

review_title: Great job experience as a student
job_title: Engineering Student Management in Hollister, MO
pros: Incredible opportunity for gaining experience while studying.
cons: Hard to maintain good work life balance at time if you're not intentional

job_title: Faculty Member in Point Lookout, MO
pros: Great retirement benefits, good health insurance for the employee only, not their family.
cons: No work life balance. Teaching load is too high requiring work in the evenings and weekends. Very little communication from administration regarding job performance.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Point Lookout, MO
pros: C of O loves to hire recent grads for this position. Everyone is very caring about you and your well being. You travel 50% of the time. You have June and July off.
cons: You only work and are paid 10 months out of the year.

job_title: Resident Director in Point Lookout, MO
cons: Salary not as high as other local schools

job_title: Residence Director in Point Lookout, MO
pros: I love my job. I love this institution.
cons: Nothing I care to speak about.

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Branson, MO
pros: Student worker, part time, work for my education
cons: Limited access, student worker, worked for my education

job_title: Public Relations Specialist in Springfield, MO
pros: The team environment was extremely supportive.
cons: The work/life balance of this position was very hard to maintain. I was never truly required or mandated to work over my dedicated time, but it was almost needed with how understaffed the office was.

pros: Ability to work independently, challenging work
cons: A lot of responsibility but no authority

job_title: Student Technician in Point Lookout, MO
cons: It is a work study program

job_title: Psychology Office Assistant in Point Lookout, MO
pros: I like earning my education through the work scholarship program.
cons: It is difficult at times, yet rewarding.

review_title: Excellent opportunity to gain work experience while in college
pros:
-Gain work experience in your field or a related area while still in college
-Completely pay for tuition by working only 20 hours per week and one 40 hour work week per semester
-Oppotuntities to pay for room and board also available
-Christian environment
cons:
-Some miscommunication between departments, management, and school leadership
-Misallocation of student labor population
-Requirements in some work stations to work on Sundays (understandable in housing, cafeteria, and maintenance, but the restaurant and hotel are by no means required to be open on Sundays)
-Conflicts on interest between departments allowing students to get away with poor work habits

job_title: Student Worker in Point Lookout, MO
pros: We work 15 hours a week at assigned campus workstations to completely offset the cost of our tuition.
cons: You start off at "entry" level jobs that are sometimes not the most enjoyed, however, you can apply to move each semester.

job_title: Dean of Sports in Point Lookout, MO
pros: Great school and mission and outstanding benefits
cons: administrative structure, Lack of communication from lead administrators.

review_title: C of O is a fabulous place to work
pros: great students, Christian atmosphere, stability, flexible, provides benefits
cons:
No room for advancement
Very political

pros: Great Education and no student loans
